page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There has been a settlement on the site of Strathaven since the early medieval period and probably earlier for Roman,Celtic and Stone Age remains have been found in the area.By 1450 the town had become a Burgh in Barony and weaving had been introduced by Flemish settlers,hence Flemington. Strathaven was a strong Covenanting area and their is now a{Covenanting {Trail}to follow.In the 18th and 19th centuries handloom weaving was the principal occupation of the town.The {Sun Inn,}now Gershwins was a coaching inn built in 1809 and the previous inn on the same site probably did the same job.Just outside the town is Lauder Ha' the home of Sir Harry Lauder.In common with many small towns Strathaven finally lost it's railway in 1965.The castle is the most obvious reminder of the past but others exist.
